Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw different habitats, including at least one land habitat (like a playground or forest) and one water habitat (like a pond or lake).
The student can draw and label different types of living things, such as trees, grasses, or bushes, within each habitat.
The student can draw and label various animals in each habitat, like lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can compare and contrast, through their drawings, the types of living things found in the different habitats.
The student can identify and mark patterns of plant and animal diversity across the different habitats, using observations or information from media sources.
